text: Roland Maurice Jefferson (born September 3, 1923) was an American botanist. He was the first African-American botanist to work for the United States National Arboretum. He worked there from 1956 to 1987. He was a well known person when it came to flowering cherry trees. He wrote a 1977 book on how Washington, D.C. got its famous cherry trees. ==References== Category:1923 births Category:Living people Category:American botanists Category:Scientists from Washington, D.C. Category:Writers from Washington, D.C.
title: Roland Jefferson
